abstract: Anxiety and malaise are building among Puerto Ricans in face of threatened increases in austerity measures to stave off growing economic disaster; government has said it will soon be unable to pay its $73 billion debt, while residents are already being squeezed by cuts.
lead_paragraph: As the commonwealth grapples with a $73 billion debt it calls unpayable, residents are dealing with higher sales tax and bracing for revenue-increasing cuts.

headline.main: Despair and Anger as Puerto Ricans Cope With Debt Crisis
headline.print_headline: Anxiety Builds as Puerto Ricans Face Debt Crisis

snippet: As the commonwealth grapples with a $73 billion debt it calls unpayable, residents are dealing with higher sales tax and bracing for revenue-increasing cuts.
